trans-unit.source: "Accessible Books" are books that work well for people with impaired vision. With the ePUB format*, it is possible to make "Born Accessible" books that work well for everyone**, regardless of vision. Bloom has the following tools to help you create these books:
trans-unit.note: The * and ** are footnote markers that should remain the same.
trans-unit.target: “Wuj ya'tal okem ” "are taq wuj b’anom chi kech ri winaq k’o ne jun k’ax pa kib’aq’wach. Ruk’ ri q’in ePUB* kb’an ne kowinem chech ri ub’anik ri wuj “Ya'tal okem are taq xtik uloq" kchakun chi kech konojel**, Jas ne ri k’ax chech ri ub’aqwach. Bloom k’o ri chakub’al chech ato’ik ub’anik we wuj ri’:

trans-unit.source: This tool, the Accessibility Checker, has:
trans-unit.target: We chakub’al, "Ilonel rech ya'tal okib'al", k'o rech:

trans-unit.source: The "Accessibility Checklist" which is where Bloom checks over your book and points you to anything that needs attention, especially for speakers of minority languages.
trans-unit.target: Ri "Chol ilonik rech okib’al” chila’ pa wi ri Bloom kunik’oj jas ri awuj xuquje’ kk’utu ronojel ri sutaq kraj rilik, pacha’ ne ri winaq kech’aw pa ri tzijob’al man e k’i taj.

trans-unit.source: The "Ace by DAISY Checker" searches the actual ePUB generated by Bloom looking for any problems.
trans-unit.target: Ri ilonel "Ace by Daisy Checker" kunik’oj ri k’olib’al ePUB ya’om rumal Bloom chech utzukuxik ri k’i taq k’axk'olil.

trans-unit.source: While the ideal is that a single book can serve everyone, the ePUB standard and ePUB readers do not actually support that. They currently only work for blind people who speak a language that is supported by "Text to Speech" (TTS) systems. At this time, TTS is only available for large or commercially interesting languages. Until the standard and accessible readers improve, it is necessary to make special versions of accessible books for minority language speakers. For blind readers to hear the image descriptions, we need to put something special on the page. In this version of Bloom, you do this by clicking the "Include image descriptions on page" checkbox in the Publish:ePUB screen. Future versions may have other options in this area.
trans-unit.target: Ri kurajawaj qak'u'x are k’ut uwokik jun no’jwuj kub’ana upatan chi kech konojel. Man kb’antaj ta kowinem ruk' q’in ePUB xuquje’ ri sik’il taq rech ePUB xa rumal xuwi kchakun chi kech ri winaq man keka’y taj xuwi ri kech’aw pa jun tzijob’al k’o tob’anik chi kech pa kematal chak "Text to Speech" (TTS) te'qne "Woktz’ib’ ruk’ ch’ab’alil". Kamik ri’, ri TTS xuwi ya'tal chi kech nik’aj taq tzijob’al k’i uwinaqil kekojowik. Kab'an na rutzil ri q’in xuquje’ ri sik’ib’al ePUB rech kuya'o kokisax pa taq Wuj ya'tal okib'al chi kech ri winaq kech’aw pa ri tzijob’al chi man e k’i taj. Chi kech ri winaq ri man keka'y taj rech kkita le kab'ix para uwi' ub'antajik taq le wachib'al rajawaxik kqanim na jun such pa ri uxaq wuj. Chi upam we jun ub’antajik Bloom, kb’an kowinem chech ruk’ ub’anik pitz’ pa uwi’ ri k’olib’al "Ukojik uya’ik ri kkb’ij ri wachib’al chi upam ri uxaq wuj" pa ri wok ilb’al wachaj Tzijob’exik:ePUB. Chwe’q kb’ij kb’an chi nik’aj pa koksax chi na nik’aj taq okib’al chik chech we uqajib’al ri upam.

Used in various places where something can be opened or linked to for advanced features. One use is an expandable area in Sign Language toolbox.

In a wizard, this button takes you to the previous step.
This tooltip shows over the Bloom Enterprise icon.

This is shown at the bottom of a dialog box. It is paired with an action button like "OK" and it means "do not do the action". In English, this is the same as "Common.CancelProcess", but could be different in your language.
This is identical to Common.Cancel. The duplication was introduced by a mistake.
This is shown at the bottom of a dialog box. It is paired with an action button like "OK" and it means "do not do the action".

If you include "&" (which represents an ampersand) in your translation, it will not be visible in Bloom. Instead, the letter following it will be a keyboard shortcut (e.g., &Cancel means that alt-C can be used to activate the Cancel button.) The letter marked with ampersand is usually the first one but does not have to be. It is important not to mark the same letter in two different controls in the same dialog. If you are not sure, just don't include the "amp;"; the only consequence is that this control cannot be activated using an alt-key shortcut.
Used typically for a button that closes a dialog box. Unlike "OK", "Close" is not agreeing to anything, it's just dismissing the dialog box.
This is shown at the bottom of a dialog box and means to go ahead with some action. It is often paired with "Cancel"
Shown in a list of messages when Bloom has completed a task.
A heading shown above some messages.
Used for the Finish button in wizards, like that used for making a New Collection
Used as a label for additional information, like duration etc in the Sign Language Tool
A link or button that leads to something that tells the user more about what they just read.
This is the same as Settings.Enterprise.LearnMore
This is shown when Bloom is slowly loading something, so the user doesn't worry about why they don't see the result immediately.

trans-unit.target: Bloom xuqajisaj ri wuj, xa k’ut man xkowin ta chech uya’ik jamalik uwach pa Bloom. Chb’ana toqob’, chatzija chi jumul chik ri akematz’ib’ xuquje’ chab’ana jumul chik. We kwil chi jumul we jun oqxa’n ri', chb’ana toq’ob’ chb’ana pitz' pa uwi’ ri “Detalles” xuquje’ chya ub’ixik ri k’axk'olil chi kech ri ajkemal taq chak rech Bloom

trans-unit.source: There was a problem downloading the book. You can try again at a different time, or write to us at issues@bloomlibrary.org if you cannot get the download to work from your location.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9): There was a problem downloading your book.
trans-unit.target: Man xb’an ta ta kowinem chech uqajisaxik ri wuj. Chb’ana jumul pa jun q’ij chik xuquje’ kaya ub’ixik chi qech chi upam we issues@bloomlibrary.org we man xatkowin ta chech uqajisaxik.

trans-unit.source: There was a problem downloading your book. You may need to restart Bloom or get technical help.
trans-unit.target: Man xb’antaj ta kowinem chech uqajisaxik ri awuj. Kraj ne rajawaxik kab'an k’ak’umajik jumul chik ri Bloom te'qne uta'ik tob'anik chech jun k’o reta’mab’al chi rij.

trans-unit.source: There was a problem downloading the book: something took too long. You can try again at a different time, or write to us at issues@bloomlibrary.org if you cannot get the download to work from your location.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, capitalization of website): There was a problem downloading the book: something took too long. You can try again at a different time, or write to us at issues@BloomLibrary.org if you cannot get the download to work from your location.
trans-unit.target: Man xb’an ta kowinem chech uqajisaxik le no’jwuj: sib'alaj xb'eyetajik. Chb’ana jumul pa jun q’ij chik te'qne kaya ub’ixik chi qech pa we issues@bloomlibrary.org we man xatkowin ta chech uqajisaxik.

trans-unit.target: Chab'ana pe utz'apaxik le jule' taq kematal chak k'ate k'u ri' chab'ana umajik le akematz'ib' we rajawaxik.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to modify or delete this page.
trans-unit.target: Kuya'o kk'ex uwach te'qne kachup we uxaq wuj ri'.

trans-unit.source:
The file you’ve chosen is a “JPEG” file. JPEG files are perfect for photographs and color artwork. However, JPEG files are a big problem for black and white line art. Problems include:
• Fuzziness and grey dots.
• Large file sizes, making the book hard to share.
• If there are many large JPEGs, Bloom may not have enough memory to make PDF files.

Note: Because JPEG is “lossy”, converting a JPEG to PNG, TIFF, or BMP actually makes things even worse. If this is black and white line art, you want to get an original scan in one of those formats.

Please select from one of the following, then click “OK”:
trans-unit.target:
Le k'olchak xcha'ik are jun k'olchak "JPEG". Le k'oltaq chak JPEG sib'alaj utz chi kech le wachib'al te'qne le wiqtaq wachib'al e q'o'talik. Xa are kuya k'ax chech taq le je'l taq ub'anik juch' chi q'eqsaq. Le k'axk'olil rachi'l taq:
• Moymotem xuquje' sal taq nak'.
• Nima'q k'oltaq chak, ri kuya k'ax chech ujachik le no'jwuj.
• We k'o sib'alaj taq k'olchak JPEG sib'alaj nim upam, kraj ne Bloom man k'o ta nim upam chech ub'anik PDFs.

 Ub'ixikil: Rumal le q'in rech JPEG kuya "tzaq", uk'exik jun k'olchak JPEG pa PNG, TIFF te'qne BMP kanimtaj le k'axk'olil. We le k'olchak are jun je'lb'anoj juch' chi q'eqsaq, rajawaxik uk'amik jun uq'axexik wachib'al le qas uxe'al pa we jun taq q'in ri'.

 Chab'ana jun toq'ob' chcha' jun chi kech taq we q'in ri' k'ate k'u ri' chb'ana pitz' pa "Uk'ulaxik":

trans-unit.source: This option is only available in the Publish tab.
trans-unit.target: We jun ya'tal ucha'ik, xuwi jamal uwach pa we jun k'utjaqb'al "Utzijob'exik".

trans-unit.note: Default file and folder name when you make a new book, but haven't give it a title yet.

trans-unit.target: We jun kajxukut k'o k'i taq woktz'ib' chi upam rumal xq'ax uwi'

trans-unit.source: A container on this page is overflowing
trans-unit.note: This shows up in pages like the cover where sizing is very flexible. No one thing is too big, but not everything on the page will fit. To see it, put a lot of text on a cover page, until a red bar appears at the bottom; then hover over the bar.
trans-unit.target: Jun k'olnim upam rech we uxaq wuj ri' katajin kel uloq uwi'

trans-unit.source: That change is not allowed. Front matter and back matter pages must remain where they are.
trans-unit.target: Man kuk'am ta le k'exenik. Le uxaq taq wuj rech le nab'e xuquje' k'isb'al chakub'al rajawaxik kek'oji' jawi' e k'o wi.

trans-unit.target: Man k'o ta k'olik pa taq le k'olk'iwuj chi rajawaxik knak' chi ri'.

trans-unit.target: Man k'o ta kaya chila' we katajin kawok jun b'anuxe'al no'jwuj.

This tool allows users to insert speech bubbles or callouts, which are pieces of text connected by a line, arrow, or other graphic to a part of a picture. These may be used to give dialogue or to give more information about a specific part of the picture.

"Report" as in "Report this problem to Bloom Support"

trans-unit.source: Please move your collection closer to the root of your hard drive and try again. A file Bloom was working with had a path that was too long. This is usually caused by your collection being too deeply nested in many folders on your hard drive.
trans-unit.target: Please move your collection closer to the root of your hard drive and try again. A file Bloom was working with had a path that was too long. This is usually caused by your collection being too deeply nested in many folders on your hard drive.

trans-unit.source: Bloom had a problem showing this book. This doesn't mean your work is lost, but it does mean that something is out of date, is missing, or has gone wrong.
trans-unit.target: Bloom man kakowin ta chech uk'utik we no'jwuj ri'. Te'qne' kub'ij chi xtzaq ri achak xuquje' kub'ij chi k'o jastaq ri man k'ak'arisam taj, karaj na te'qne' xub'an k'ax.

trans-unit.source: Bloom was not able to copy the metadata to {0} image(s): {1}. Try restarting your computer. If that does not fix the problem, please send us a report and we will help you fix it.
trans-unit.note: The placeholder {0} will get a number that is the count of how many image files had a problem.
The placeholder {1} will get a list of the names of image files that had a problem.
trans-unit.target: Bloom was not able to copy the metadata to {0} image(s): {1}. Try restarting your computer. If that does not fix the problem, please send us a report and we will help you fix it.

trans-unit.note: displays as a "toast", {0} is the URL/filename
trans-unit.target: Man loq' taj kab'an okem pa {0}

trans-unit.source: Bloom was unable to start its own HTTP listener that it uses to talk to its embedded Firefox browser. If this happens even if you just restarted your computer, then ask someone to investigate if you have an aggressive firewall product installed, which may need to be uninstalled before you can use Bloom.
trans-unit.note: OLD TEXT (before 3.9, shorter wording): Bloom was unable to start its own HTTP listener that it uses to talk to its embedded Firefox browser. If this happens even if you just restarted your computer, ask someone to investigate if you have an aggressive firewall product installed. The agressive firewall product may need to be uninstalled before you can use Bloom.
trans-unit.target: Bloom man xkowin ta chech umajik ri HTTP Listener, kojom chech ri ch'awem ruk' ri tzukunel uk'amom rib rech Firefox. We jeri' kak'ulmatajik man xa ta ne rumal k'ate xk'aka'risax jumul chik le kematz'ib', rajawaxik kata chech jun chik kunik'oj we jeqeb'am jun k'ayij ub'i' ch'u'j ramq'aq' (Cortafuegos agresivo). Karaj ne rajawaxik resaxik ri ramq'aq' rech kb'an kowinem chech ukojik Bloom.

trans-unit.source: Bloom had trouble saving a page. Please report the problem to us. Then quit Bloom, run it again, and check to see if the page you just edited is missing anything. Sorry!
trans-unit.target: Bloom xuriq k'axk'olil are taq katajin kuk'ol ri uxaq. Chab'ana jun toq'ob', chab'ana pitz' pa "Detalles" k'o chi uxe' xuquje' chab'ij uloq chi qech. K'ate k'u ri' chatz'apij Bloom, chak'ak'arisaj jumul chik xuquje' chanik'oj uwach wene le uxaq le k'ate' xa kolomisaj k'o kraj na chech. ¡Chakuyu qamak!

trans-unit.note: The placeholder {0} represents the current version of Bloom. For example, {0} might be replaced with "4.3"

trans-unit.source: This might be caused by Windows Defender "Controlled Folder Access" or some other virus protection.

trans-unit.target: We k'ulmatajem ri' are kab'anow le Windows Defender "Okib'al chajim pa k'olyakb'al chak" (Controlled Folder Access) te'qne' rumal jun kematal chak rech uq'atel uchikopil.

trans-unit.source: This program cannot write to the folder {0}.

trans-unit.target: Le kematal chak man kkowin taj ktz'ib'an chi upam ri k'olyakb'al chak {0}.

trans-unit.source: This Collection called for Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but this version of Bloom does not have it, and Bloom could not find it on this computer. The collection has been changed to use the default Front/Back Matter pages.

trans-unit.target: We no'jwuj ri' kukoj le Woktanaj rech Unab'esaxik/K'isb'al chakub'al ub'i' {0}', xa k'ut we uwach chak rech Bloom man k'o ta chi upam, rumal la' Bloom man xkowin taj xuriqik pa we kematz'ib' ri'. We wokcha'talik ri' b'anom usuk'umaxik rech kkoj pa taq le Chakub'al Unab'esaxik/K'isb'al rech.

trans-unit.note: This shows in the 'toast' that pops up to notify the user of a non-fatal problem.
trans-unit.target: K'axk'olil ruk' le Chakub'al Unab'esaxik/K'isb'al rech

trans-unit.source: This book called for a Front/Back Matter pack named '{0}', but this version of Bloom does not have it, and Bloom could not find it on this computer. The book has been changed to use the Front/Back Matter pages from the Collection Settings.
trans-unit.target: We no'jwuj kukoj le Woktanaj rech Unab'esaxik/K'isb'al rech ub'i' {0}', xa k'ut we jun wokchak rech Bloom man k'o ta chi upam rumal la' man kuriq ta chi upam we kematz'ib' ri' . Le no'jwuj xk'extaj ukojik rech kuya'o kokisax le uxaq taq rech le Chakub'al Unab'esaxik/K'isb'al rech le "Suk'umanem rech le Wokcha'talik".

trans-unit.source: Bloom cannot start properly, and this symptom has been observed on machines with ZoneAlarm installed. Note: disabling ZoneAlarm does not help. Nor does restarting with it turned off. Something about the installation of ZoneAlarm causes the problem, and so far only uninstalling ZoneAlarm has been shown to fix the problem.
trans-unit.target: Bloom man kakowin taj kumaj suk' uchak. Wa' we retal k'ulmatajem iltajinaq pa taq kematz'ib' ruk' ZoneAlarm jeqeb'am. Ub'ixikil: Chupuk'asuxik ZoneAlarm man kusol ta rij we k'axk'olil ri'. K'ak'umajik le kematal chak ruk' ZoneAlarm chupinaq xuquje' man kusol ta rij le k'axk'olil. Rech kasolotaj uwach le k'axk'olil rajawaxik resaxik ri ZoneAlarm.

trans-unit.source: A component of Bloom, BloomPdfMaker.exe, seems to be missing. This prevents previews and printing. Antivirus software sometimes does this. You may need technical help to repair the Bloom installation and protect this file from being deleted again.

Le kematal taq chak rech ri uq'atel uchikopil te'qne' are keb'anow wa'. Kuya'o kata to'b'anik chi kech le nim keta'amb'al para pa uwi' taq le ub'anik rutzil le ujeqeb'axik le Bloom xuquje' rech uto'ik uwi' we k'olchak ri' we xchup jumul chik.

trans-unit.source: A collection of shell or template books in one or more languages of wider communication. You will be able to upload these shells to BloomLibrary.org. You may also make a Bloom Pack to give to others so that they can make local language books with your shells.
trans-unit.target: Jun wokcha'tal no'jwuj wokotal chik te'qne' rech raqanib'al pa jun wene pa k'i nima'q taq tzijob'al kokisax chech ri tzijonem. Katkowinik kapaqab'a' we no'jwuj wokotal chik pa BloomLibrary.org. Xuquje' katkowinik kawok jun Woktanaj rech Bloom rech ula'nik kuk' jule' chik rech kakiwok no'jwuj pa ri ajwaral kitzijob'al ruk' taq le no'jwuj wokotal chik chi kawok na.

trans-unit.source: A collection of books in a local language.
trans-unit.target: Jun wokcha'talik rech No'jwuj pa ajwaral tzijob'al.
Uya'ik ub'ixik le kariqitaj wi le tzijob'al

trans-unit.source: These are optional. Bloom will place them in the right places on title page of books you create.
trans-unit.target: Wa' we ri' ya'tal ucha'ik. Bloom ke'ukoj pa taq suk' uk'olib'al pa ri uwach taq no'jwuj ri ke'awoko.

trans-unit.note: The {0} is replaced by the name of the language.

trans-unit.source: Unable to create a new collection using that name.
trans-unit.target: Man kab'an ta kowinem chech uwokik jun k'ak' wokcha'talik ruk' le b'i'aj le'.

trans-unit.source: You are almost ready to start making books.
trans-unit.target: Man nim ta chi karaj rech loq' kamajtaj uwokik no'jwuj.

trans-unit.source: In order to keep things simple and organized, Bloom keeps all the books you make in one or more Collections. The first thing we need to do is make one for you.
trans-unit.target: Ruk' ri rayb'al che uk'olem ronojel ma k'ex taj xuquje' ujeqalik, Bloom uk'olom ronpjel taq ri k'i taq no'jwuj che ri lal kwok la pa jun o k'i <i>Colecciones</ i>. Ri nab'e rajawaxik kqab'ano are uwokik jun ucha'ik uwach chech la.
Chab'ana pitz' pa 'Jun chik' rech umajik.

trans-unit.source: Bloom detected that this collection is located in your Dropbox folder. This can cause problems as Dropbox sometimes locks Bloom out of its own files. If you have problems, we recommend that you move your collection somewhere else or disable Dropbox while using Bloom.
trans-unit.target: Bloom xrilo chi we wokcha'talik ri' kriqitaj pa jun k'olchak rech Dropbox. Wa' k'o kuya k'axk'olil xa rumal k'o karaj Dropbox kuq'atej Bloom ruk' taq ri uk'olchak. We k'o k'axk'olil, kkoqxa'nij chi solob'isax pa jun wokcha'talik para jun k'olib'al chik te'qne' pa utoq'ob'axik Dropbox rech kab'an ukojik aq'anoq Bloom.

trans-unit.source: This collection is part of your 'Sources for new books' which you can see in the bottom left of the Collections tab. It cannot be opened for editing.
trans-unit.target: We wokcha'talik ri' k'o chi upam ri "Kemuxe' rech k'ak' taq no'jwuj" le kiltaj chi uxe' pa moxq'ab' rech ri k'utjaqb'al rech Wokcha'talik. Man kuya taj kk'exik.

trans-unit.note: This shows in the file-open dialog that you use to open a different bloom collection

trans-unit.source: Has someone else used Send/Receive to share a collection with you?\nUse one of these red buttons to copy their collection to your computer.\nLater, use Send/Receive to share your work back with them.
trans-unit.target: ¿K'o jun xujach chi awech jun ub'i' k'i uwach rumal ucha'ik ub'e Taqik/K'amik?\n Chakojo' jun chech wa kaq taq pitz'ib'al rech resaxik uwach le wokcha'talik pa le akematz'ib'. \nK'ate' k'u ri', chakojo' Taqik/K'amik rech kjach le achak kuk' e are'.
Uk'exik le tzijob'al rech le uxo'lal uwach

trans-unit.source: Pages can not be re-ordered when you are translating a book.
trans-unit.target: Are taq katajin kq'axex jun no'jwuj pa jun tzijob'al chik, le uxaq taq man kb'an ta kowinem chech taq kicholaxik.
Uch'ob'ik uwujil patanib'al rech Upetik Uq'ob'al rech le wokchak Adobe

trans-unit.note: This is shown while Bloom is sharing a book over wifi, over a usb cable, or uploading.
This is shown while Bloom is sharing a book over wifi or over a usb cable.

trans-unit.source: Please install Adobe Reader so that Bloom can show your completed book. Until then, you can still save the PDF Book and open it in some other program.
trans-unit.target: Chab'ana jun toq'ob' chajeqab'a' le wokchak Adobe Reader rech Bloom kkowin chech ukuk'ut le no'jwuj. K'ate k'u ri' kuya'o katkowinik kak'ol le no'jwuj PDF xuquje' kator ruk' jun kematal chak chik.

trans-unit.source: That's strange... Adobe Reader gave an error when trying to show that PDF. You can still try saving the PDF Book.
trans-unit.target: ¡Sib'alaj mayib'al!... Adobe Reader xuriq jun k'axk'olil are taq xraj uk'utik le PDF. Kuya na chi kab'an rilik uk'olik le no'jwuj pa q'in PDF.

trans-unit.source: Sad News. Bloom wasn't able to get Adobe Reader to show here, so Bloom can't show your completed book.\nPlease uninstall your existing version of 'Adobe Reader' and (re)install 'Adobe Reader'.\nUntil you get that fixed, you can still save the PDF Book and open it in some other program.
trans-unit.target: Chakuyu', Bloom ma xkowin ta chech utorik Adobe Reader, rumal ri' Bloom man kakowin taj kuk'ut ri no'jwuj. \nChab'ana toq'ob', chawesaj le uwach chak jeqeb'an rech 'Adobe Reader' k'ate' k'u ri' chajeqab'a chi jumul 'Adobe Reader'.\nK'a are taq kkowin chech usolik rech kuk'ol le no'wuj PDF xuquje' rech kuya'o kator pa jun kematal chak chik.

trans-unit.source: You can use sharing apps like email, Dropbox, and WhatsApp to get your .bloomd file onto a device.
trans-unit.target: Katkowinik kakoj rech ujachik pacha' ri oqxa'n pa kematz'ib', Dropbox xuquje' WhatsApp rech ujachik ri ak'olchak.bloomd ruk' jun chik wiqkem chakub'al.

trans-unit.source: You can use SD cards and sharing apps like email, Google Drive, and WhatsApp to get your .bloompub file onto a device that has Bloom Reader (Android) or BloomPUB Viewer (Windows). You can also create a stand-alone app using Reading App Builder.
trans-unit.note: The 3 links should be left untranslated as well as the file type '.bloompub'. Beware of machine translations that eliminate the 'b'.
trans-unit.target: You can use SD cards and sharing apps like email, Google Drive, and WhatsApp to get your .bloompub file onto a device that has Bloom Reader (Android) or BloomPUB Viewer (Windows). You can also create a stand-alone app using Reading App Builder.

trans-unit.source: Make a BloomPUB for Bloom Reader or Reading App Builder.
trans-unit.target: Make a BloomPUB for Bloom Reader or Reading App Builder.

trans-unit.source: BloomPUBs are a kind of eBook that can be read on phone apps ([Bloom Reader](https://bloomlibrary.org/page/create/bloom-reader) and [Reading App Builder](https://software.sil.org/readingappbuilder/)) and on Windows using [BloomPUB Viewer](https://bloomlibrary.org/page/create/downloads#related-software). They offer many advantages over ePUBs, including WYSIWYG fidelity and the full range of Bloom digital book features.
trans-unit.note: Task description at the top of the BloomPUB Publishing page
trans-unit.target: BloomPUBs are a kind of eBook that can be read on phone apps ([Bloom Reader](https://bloomlibrary.org/page/create/bloom-reader) and [Reading App Builder](https://software.sil.org/readingappbuilder/)) and on Windows using [BloomPUB Viewer](https://bloomlibrary.org/page/create/downloads#related-software). They offer many advantages over ePUBs, including WYSIWYG fidelity and the full range of Bloom digital book features.

trans-unit.note: "Make" is the label of a button that will make the selected file
A BloomPUB is a type of file format that can be used to read books on the Bloom Reader app
"Compress" means to take multiple things and turn them into a single combined file. (The result is smaller than the sum of the parts.)
.bloombundle is the file extension. It is in lowercase. It will be the same extension regardless of the user's language settings.

trans-unit.source: Upload your book to BloomLibrary.org so that other people can read it, download it to their devices, and share it with other people.

trans-unit.note: Used in Epubs as the text of a link that leads from the image description back to the main page

Here, the English 'Accessibility' is a common way of refering to technologies that are usable by people with disabilities. With computers, this usually means people with visual impairments. It includes botht he blind and people who might need text to be larger, or who are colorblind, etc.

This is a header in a table, under another heading "Words". Table cells contain values like 23(10) indicating that 23 is the maximum number of words allowed in a book (counting repeated words), and 10 is the maximum number of unique words (not counting repeats).

trans-unit.source: Bloom Enterprise adds features and services that are important for publishers, governments, and international organizations. This paid subscription meets their unique needs while supporting the development and user support of Bloom for the community at large.
trans-unit.target: Bloom wokk’ayinel kuya uwi’ taq chak xuquje’ patanib'al chi nim upatan chi kech le wokolomanelab', q’atab’al taq tzij rech amaq’, wokaj ajch’aqaja’ xuquje’ jule' chik. Le tojom utz'ib'axik ib', kuya uq'ij le jalajoj taq rajawaxik xuquje’ ktob’an chech ri k’iyirisanem rech Bloom chi kech konojel ri komon ri kekojowik.
